metadata.title: CVE-2018-10930 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in RPC request using gfs3_rename_req in glusterfs server.An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to write to a destinationoutside the gluster volume.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10930` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 3.4.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-common - 3.4.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-server - 3.4.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.2-1ubuntu1+esm1').
